utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Gentlemen, I think I’ve come up with a fun way to get young people interested in science. Physics Mad-Libs. Now, give me a number.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Five.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh-huh. And an irrational constant.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: E.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And a funny Greek letter.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Gamma.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I said funny.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Upsilon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good one. And an electrical charge.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Positive.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ha. Perfect. Okay. Get this. Professor Jones told the symposium he had a new method for calculating the mass of a muon. Five times the limit of E to the upsilon as in a . Okay. No, no. I’ll start over. Professor

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I haven’t seen him laugh that hard since the day Leonard made that multiplication error.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, Oh, Lord, that multiplication error! He thought he carried the one. But he didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s not funny. That mistake got published.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Stop! I’m going to wet myself!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, guys, guys, President Siebert is headed this way.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I wonder what he wants.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Doesn’t look happy, so I’m guessing he wants to talk to Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Seibert
utterance.content: Dr. Cooper?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Told ya.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, President Siebert, I assume you’d like to respond to one of the suggestions I put in the box by your office.

utterance.speaker: Seibert
utterance.content: No, and stop installing suggestion boxes everywhere.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You don’t like written suggestions. You don’t like when I give them to you while we’re urinating in the men’s room. If I didn’t know any better, I’d say that you’re one of those stubborn people who are not open to suggestions.

utterance.speaker: Seibert
utterance.content: Dr. Cooper, the physics department chair tells me you’re refusing to take your vacation.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t need a vacation.

utterance.speaker: Seibert
utterance.content: You’re obligated to take one. And I’d also like you to know the most-often received suggestion in my suggestion box you installed without asking me is can Dr. Cooper take a vacation? Okay, settled, then. I’ll see you all on Monday, except for you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But if I don’t come into work, what am I supposed to do with myself?

utterance.speaker: Seibert
utterance.content: Read, rest, travel. I hear Afghanistan is nice this time of year.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sarcasm?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. You should go.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That tonight’s gonna be a good night, and tonight’s gonna be a good night, and tonight’s gonna be a good, good night! Tonight’s the night, uh, uh, let’s live it up, uh, I got my money, let’s spend it up…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (appearing in the back seat)
utterance.content: Good Lord! Would you stop that caterwauling!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What the hell are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Bleeding from my ears.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you doing hiding back there?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sneaking into work. Now, if the guard at the university asks what’s under the blanket, you tell him it’s some lobster traps.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Lobster traps?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. That’s how Velma and Scooby smuggled Shaggy into the old lighthouse.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you going to do when you get to the university? People are going to recognize you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Will they, Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine. Just get back under your blanket, and I’ll drive you there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And no more singing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I have GPS on my phone. I know you turned around.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m so glad you talked Howard out of having your wedding invitations in Klingon.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Turn it over. I’m hoping my relatives think it’s Hebrew.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: This is really happening. I’m gonna be a maid of honour. I’m gonna wear a beautiful dress and walk down that aisle and, finally, I will have my special day.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You mean my special day?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: They’re gonna need an extra-large veil for somebody’s head.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: If I ever actually ever get married.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why wouldn’t you?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: My dad. Because I make a lot more money than Howie, he’s putting a lot of pressure on me to get a pre-nup.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ouch.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah. Howie’s gonna freak out.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Parental pressure can be daunting. I remember the battle with my mother about shaving my legs. Last year, I finally gave in and let her do it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I just don’t know how I’m gonna break it to him.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, I’m a big believer in breaking bad news to a guy when you’re in bed with him. That’s how I told my high school boyfriend I slept with his brother. That’s how I told his brother the same thing.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t know, I don’t want to manipulate him with sex.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, sweetie, that’s what sex is for.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know, the connection between marriage and money is nothing new. In fact, the term wed referred to the money and livestock that the groom paid the bride’s father. For example, you’re adorable, intelligent and a good earner. I could conservatively see you going for at least two oxen and a goose. You would fetch a unicorn.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, there are a million great vacations you could take. What about Hawaii?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hawaii is a former leper colony on top of an active volcano where the disappointing ending to Lost was filmed. Mahalo for nothing, Hawaii.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How about Florida? They’ve got Cape Canaveral, they’ve got Disney, they’ve got my Aunt Ida and the world’s largest collection of diabetic candy. Plus, if you get sweaty enough, her plastic-covered furniture is like a flume ride.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My family took a trip to Florida when I was a child. A seagull stole a hot dog from me on the beach. I got the message.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know, if I had a week off, I’d go back to the Two Bunch Palms Resort and Spa in the desert. I tell you, an hour on the massage table with Trevor, and you’ll feel like you were born without bones.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t think I could ever let a guy give me a massage.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Really? What was I doing to your neck last night while you were playing X-Box?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s like I’m living in a dictatorship. You must take a vacation, you must have fun, you must enjoy life.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t think you have a good handle on dictatorships.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, everybody takes vacations.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: One time they tried to make Richard Feynman take a vacation, but he chose instead to expand his mind and learn something new. He went to work in his friend’s biology lab. Richard Feynman was a famous American physicist, part of the Manhattan Project.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Everyone in the world of science knows who Richard Feynman was.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now you do, too. Oh! I have a brilliant idea. Amy’s a biologist. I’ll go work in her lab.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Isn’t that just Feynman’s idea?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ten seconds ago, you never heard of him. Now you’re an expert.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Is that your laundry? You only have, like, six things in there.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I didn’t have any quarters, so I’ve been sneaking stuff into other people’s loads all day. Hey, if I tell you something, will you promise not to tell anybody?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It doesn’t matter what I say, you’re gonna tell me anyway.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What? That is not true. Bernadette wants a pre-nup.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wow. That’s rough.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So you’re saying if I became a famous movie star, we got married, you wouldn’t sign a pre-nup?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Absolutely not. If I’m gonna be stuck at home with the kids while you’re on location cheating on me with Ryan Gosling, then Leonard gots to get paid. So, you think about us getting married?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I think about a lot of things. I think about us getting married, I think about us breaking up. Once in a while, I think about how I didn’t leave a note on that Mercedes I dinged in the parking lot last month, but then I have a glass of wine and it passes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Joke all you want, but you think about it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, tell you one thing, if I ever do get married, no Klingon invitations.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good luck catching a man with that attitude.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Boy, oh, boy. This vacation is off to a wonderful start. The smell of formaldehyde, the whir of the centrifuge, the distant chatter of lab animals being dispatched for dissection. Mm, I can already feel my cares just melting away.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m excited to work with my boyfriend. It’s gonna be romantic.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Way to kill the mood.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Come on, Sheldon. We can be like Marie Curie and her husband, Pierre, who spent their days working side by side, bathed in the glow of their love and the radium that ultimately killed her. Screw Beauty and the Beast, that’s the love story Disney should tell.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, what do we start with? Maybe splicing some genes, clone a sheep, perhaps grow a human ear on a mouse’s back? Ha-ha, I’m a freak!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, I’m gonna be doing some brain stem histology while you put yourself on the business end of a sponge and wash those beakers.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wash those bea… Oh, I get it, a little hazing for the new fella. Yeah, I’d better keep and eye out for, what, shoe polish on the microscope, or mad cow disease in my grilled cheese sandwich?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, I just need those beakers washed. Hippity-hop, quick like a bunny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What? Excuse me, you have Dr. Sheldon Cooper in your lab. You’re gonna make him do the dishes? That’s like asking the Incredible Hulk to open a pickle jar.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, you’ve never worked in a lab like this before. You have no experience in the field of biology.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I have plenty of experience in biology. I bought a Tamagotchi in 1998. And it’s still alive. Let’s do this.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Where’s Howard?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No hi, Raj? No how are you, Raj? Just straight to where’s the other white guy?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sorry. So, listen, I heard something about him. Can you keep it between us?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ooh, gossip. When I first got here, I thought you Americans really gossiped around the water cooler. So I hung out there for, like, a month, but the only gossip I ever heard was about some creepy guy hanging out by the water cooler.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Bernadette wants to get a pre-nup.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, that’s a shame, he’s gonna be devastated.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I never know what to do in these situations. Should I give him a heads-up?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hmm. I’m gonna give you the same advice I yell at the TV when the Bachelor’s handing out roses. Follow your heart.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Check it out. Look at the size of that Rice Krispie Treat. Same price.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Howard, I need to tell you something.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know, it’s not on my wedding diet. I don’t care.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, listen, I heard that Bernadette’s thinking about asking you for a pre-nup.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: A pre-nup? Wow.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Follow your heart.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know what, it’s not a big deal. She makes more money than me. She wants to protect her financial interests. It’s completely reasonable.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, actually, it’s good for both of us. I have assets to protect, too.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ve got some rare comic books. The Vespa’s almost paid off. And Ma and I have a primo double cemetery plot at Mt. Sinai right near the guy who played Mr. Roper on Three’s Company.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Mr. Roper’s dead? You can’t just spring that on a guy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Here you go. This is now the only lab with glassware washed by a man with two doctorates and a restraining order signed by Carl Sagan.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Soap spots. Wash ’em again.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Y-you’re being ridiculous. Those are perfectly clean.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, this beaker used to contain cerebral spinal fluid from an elephant that died of syphilis. If it’s, in fact, perfectly clean, drink from it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Biologists are mean.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: All right, perhaps this task will be a little bit more up your alley. I need you to count the bacteria spores on these petri dishes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There was something wrong with that detergent. That was way too bubbly.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m sure it was.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I intend to write that soap company a strongly worded letter.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah, good for you. Now, start counting.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know what this place needs? A suggestion box.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How’s it going?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How’s counting going? When I was in kindergarten, I recited pi to a thousand places for the school talent show. I think I got this.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Aw, nuts! One…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is preposterous. I think you’re giving me these tasks because you’re afraid if you give me anything meaningful to do, I’ll show you up.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Really? Is that what you think?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, that’s what I think. And I’m super smart, so it’s probably true.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hey, I’ve been training in the field of neurobiology for 12 years. You’ve been here for three hours, and you’ve spent one of them in the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry. It takes me a while to get things going on an unfamiliar toilet.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, I’ve given you the simplest things to do, and you haven’t done one of them right.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Maybe that’s because I’m not being challenged. It’s the same reason Einstein failed math.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Maybe the math was too bubbly for him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You think you’re doing science by cutting up that brain? They could do the same thing at any Quiznos. And they’d offer to toast it for me, too.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay, smart guy. I’m about to remove the locus coeruleus, which is incredibly delicate work. Have at it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. I’m no stranger to a little gray matter. Locus coeruleus. Locus coeruleus.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’re getting warmer, it is, indeed, in the brain. Hope your hands are steady. It’s the width of a single hair. But this is just biology, so I’m sure it’s no problem for a genius like you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s not. I’ll have you know, in the field of physics, we work with particles so small, they make fat jokes about the locus coeruleus, i.e., when your locus coeruleus sits around the house, it sits around the house.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, are we nervous, Dr. Cooper?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. What you see is a man trembling with confidence. Does a locus coeruleus normally bleed that much?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No. But your thumb does.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, dear.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah, you’re a biologist.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m on vacation. Social convention dictates that I let my hair down at a local watering hole. Social convention is stupid.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What happened to your thumb?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, I have ten fingers and ten toes. If I tell you a story about each one of them, we’ll be here all day, let’s just move on.

utterance.speaker: Barman
utterance.content: What can I get you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ah, seeing as I’m on vacation, a pina colada seems appropriate. Extra pineapple slices, extra whipped cream, extra cherries, extra umbrellas, and, uh, hold the rum. Don’t let me have too many of those.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, what are you guys doing here?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We’re grown men, we drink at bars.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No and no. Everything okay with you and Bernadette?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, sure.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You and Amy? Good?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, better than good.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know those girls text me every detail of their lives as it happens.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m not signing a pre-nup.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, Howard Wolowitz, listen up. You sign anything she puts in front of you, because you are the luckiest man alive. If you let her go, there is no way you can find anyone else. Speaking on behalf of all women, it is not gonna happen, we had a meeting. And you, a grown man fainting at the sight of a little blood.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me, this is a fairly substantial wound.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy? Amy? Amy?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What do you want?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I was kind of hoping I could continue vacationing in your laboratory. After all, I did book the whole week.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Do you honestly think you can just waltz back in here after the way you behaved yesterday?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I was not myself. I had lost a lot of thumb blood.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s not an apology.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That is your opinion.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I want a real apology.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry that you weren’t able to…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That my genius…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That the soap was…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’re forgiven. Now, if you want to stay, get started on those beakers. They’re still dirty from yesterday.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Next year I’m going to Epcot.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Are you mad at me?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. I’m not mad at you. I just wish you would have come to me, so I didn’t have to hear it through the nerd-vine.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So, what are we gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You really want me to sign a pre-nup?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t know. My dad’s pretty insistent on it, though.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why don’t I talk to your dad, man-to-man?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Really? Oh, that’d be so great.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Done.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I should probably give you a heads-up about a couple of things. Even though he’s retired from the police force, he still carries his gun. But don’t worry, he won’t shoot it. It’s more of a fashion statement.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: And just to be safe, when you talk to him, don’t bring up Jimmy Carter, gardeners, foreign people, homosexuals, Sean Penn, Vatican II, gun control, organic food, the designated hitter rule, recycling or the fact that you’re Jewish.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Got it, got it. Will you e-mail me that list?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So the thing to watch for, if he’s shouting at you, you’re okay, but if he starts to get real quiet, leave as quickly as you can without making eye contact. Not in a straight line, throw some zigs and zigs in there.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know, this isn’t that pressing. Why don’t I talk to him about it in May.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: In May you’re gonna be on the International Space Station.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: They’ve got a phone.
